MatchedRegions.transcript: The COVID-19 pandemic continues to bring up various topics discussed or debated on social media.

MatchedRegion.Text: Is it true that Governor Cuomo has banned the promising malaria drug he do such a thing ? Can that rule be overridden by our president ?

I don' t wanna take Covid-19 Vaccine. High risk for me. . I'm immunosuppressed person and I don' t wanna let nothing more touch my inmune system . Be on "O " is enough an nightmare with side effects all the Time . And I wanna take Ocrevus just every 9 moths to let to rest my body .

MatchedRegions.transcript: In order to explore the impact of pandemics on people's lives, it is important to understand the public's concerns and attitudes towards pandemic-related entities on social media.

However, most NLP tools as well as models trained on existing name entity recognition or targeted sentiment analysis data sets have limited ability to understand COVID-19 related social media texts because these data sets are not designed or annotated from a medical perspective.

MatchedRegion.Text: Existing natural language processing (NLP) tools struggle to fulfill the surging demand for accurate social media-based public healthcare analysis due to the lack of relevant datasets.
